items.title: How Trump Has Reshaped the Justice Department and Other Criminal Justice Areas in His Second Term
items.description: From immigration to the death penalty and beyond, here are some of the administration’s key changes in criminal justice.

items.title: Trump Threatened to Send Military Police to Minnesota. Here’s What They Can and Can’t Do.
items.description: Even during unrest, active-duty soldiers’ role in domestic law enforcement is limited, experts say.

items.title: Journalists: How to Include Family Perspectives in Prison Death Coverage
items.description: Family members’ experiences are key to understanding deaths in custody. These engagement tactics can unlock their untold stories.

items.title: How ICE Agent Who Killed Renee Good Could Face State Charges
items.description: Prosecutors would have to overcome many legal obstacles, from the officer’s possible immunity claims to the laws that govern deadly use of force.

items.title: After Haitians Endured Campaign Lies, An Ohio Town Prepares For ICE
items.description: Falsely accused of eating pets, and worse, Haitians in Springfield have survived harassment, and now fear deportation.
